article_1.title: ‚ÄúTeams Are Going To Start To Catch On‚Äù
article_1.post: Joe is ecstatic about the Bucs offense thriving through two games without Mike Evans and Chris Godwin. It‚Äôs damn impressive.Others have a different view. Take ex-Bucs quarterback Chris Simms, the NBC analyst. He‚Äôs a fan of Tampa Bay and loves how the Bucs have turned Cade Otton into their top option and found ways to thrive throwing to running backs.But Simms thinks the success will be fleeting.‚ÄúTeams are going to start to catch on and slow that down and it‚Äôs going to make it tough sledding for the Buccaneers,‚Äù Simms said on Pro Football Talk.Then Simms let his frustration show.‚ÄúIt stinks,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThe Buccaneers are a playoff team but I don‚Äôt know if they can survive these injuries and where they are in this stretch of the schedule right now.‚ÄùAs for Sunday against the 49ers (4-4), Simms talked about how he considered that the Bucs (4-5) might get blown out in Tampa. But Simms, who is close friends with Niners head coach Kyle Shanahan and follows the team closely, said he released that thought because San Francisco has been too inconsistent.‚ÄúThey find ways to let teams stay in a game too often,‚Äù he said.Joe will disagree with Simms that the NFL is going to catch up to the Bucs‚Äô re-worked offense.If you have a smart playcaller, a strong offensive line, a Pro Bowl quarterback and solid skill players, NFL defenses shouldn‚Äôt figure you out.The Bucs have all those things.
article_1.article_summary: Bucs offense thriving but concerns about teams catching on.

commenter13.post: There is absolutely NO way you can say one way or the other that going for 2 was the right call. There is WAY too many variables. Ravens without question had gained momentum offensively and finally got a turnover HOWEVER the Bengals defense had shut them down for the overwhelming majority.  I think the odds of winning a coin flip to get the ball first in OT is the play. The NFL 2 point conversion success rate is ONLY a hair over 30% for this year and that‚Äôs atrocious. I want a coin toss and my quarterback who has over 400 yards in a coin flip to start OT instead. It‚Äôs annoying with all the MISCONCEPTION that you go for 2. Sabremetics at their simplest form does not apply to that situation.  There is Way too many factors. That last drive the Ravens forced the Bengals to work for every yard down to 4th down. They didn‚Äôt steam roll into the end zone. The best play would in my opinion would be go to a coin flip for OT because of the games variables. The other BS, oh we are on the road, always go for it‚Ä¶ blah blah . You can‚Äôt state that as a ‚Äúrule‚Äù. Too many mathematical ‚Äúvariables‚Äù so it‚Äôs dumb to say you always go for 2 on the road. I say mathematically, after plugging in ALL game time variables, the play was OT.

Go Bucs

article_2.title: Only Mike Evans Is Ruled Out For 49ers
article_2.post: While Bucs coach Todd Bowles wasn‚Äôt sure if defensive tackle Greg Gaines or wide receiver Jalen McMillan will play Sunday, he didn‚Äôt rule them out.In fact, the only active Bucs player ruled out is Mike Evans. Bowles suggested it would be a game-time decision for both.As for quarterback Baker Mayfield, who missed Wednesday and Thursday‚Äôs walk-through practices with a toe injury, he did practice today.‚ÄúHe looked sharp today, so he‚Äôll be okay,‚Äù Bowles said of Mayfield.As for the status of Evans‚Äô return, Bowles isn‚Äôt sure. It was hoped be ready after the bye when the Bucs travel to New Jersey to play the Giants on Nov. 24.Bowles said he really doesn‚Äôt know when Evans will be able to hit the field again but he‚Äôs improving after a nasty hamstring injury.‚ÄúI see him getting better every day. When they tell me he‚Äôs ready, he‚Äôs ready,‚Äù Bowles said.Sunday against San Francisco is the Bucs‚Äô final game before their bye.

article_3.title: George Kittle On Blocking Vita Vea: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs Fun‚Äù*
article_3.post: Props to 49ers tight end George Kittle for his biting sarcasm concerning a Bucs heavy hitter on defense.So this week in the 49ers‚Äô locker room, Kittle was asked if he ever had to square up against beastly Bucs nose tackle Vita Vea.Kittle immediately deadpanned, ‚ÄúI have before, it‚Äôs fun.‚Äù¬†The video was captured by KNBR-AM 680 in San Francisco.Then after the bait was fully swallowed, Kittle quickly got serious and admitted he wants no part of the Pro Bowl defender.‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not [fun],‚Äù Kittle said. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs really good at football. He‚Äôs a massive human. Really strong. Very fast. He‚Äôs quick and agile for his size.‚ÄúHe brings energy to the whole defense. Yes, I have ran into him before. I bounced off. It was great.‚ÄùKittle said fundamentals tell him to go low if trying to block Vea, but he doubts that will help him if the two cross paths on Sunday.‚ÄúMaybe I will get my pad level down,‚Äù Kittle said. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know if that will help at all.‚ÄùIf Joe was Todd Bowles and he heard Kittle say this, Joe would try to devise a defense to match up Vea on Kittle.* ‚Äî Kittle was being very sarcastic in his initial reaction to locking horns with Vea.
article_3.article_summary: Kittle jokingly talks about matching up against Vea in football.

article_4.title: Historic Performance By Liam Coen?
article_4.post: For now, Joe will take the word of an old man with a ton of experience calling plays in the NFL.If the Bucs‚Äô success on offense continues, Joe will dive deep into the hard research.As a first-time NFL playcaller introducing a new offense to a team, Bucs offensive coordinator Liam Coen has his club averaging 28.8 points per game.That ranks fifth in the NFL and is even slightly more impressive than it used to be considering scoring is down in the league over the past 1 1/2 seasons.Bucco Bruce Arians told Barstool Gambling that what Coen is accomplishing is more than just damn good. He praised Coen for doing a job that might be historic.‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôve ever seen anybody averaging close to 30 points a game in a first-year takeover ‚Äî in a new offense,‚Äù Arians said. ‚ÄúSo it‚Äôs a credit to the guys buying in.‚ÄùJoe just started the process of researching the performances of new NFL playcallers and first-year takeovers with a new offense. But is a little leery. Documenting Coen‚Äôs special season might help Coen move on after this season. And Joe wants no part of that.Late in the 2015 season, Joe researched then-playcaller Dirk Koetter achieving the super-rare feat of leading a top-10 offense for three different NFL franchises.Making that news public prompted a call from Koetter‚Äôs agent to Joe, which led to Joe learning about Koetter‚Äôs quest for a head coaching job. (And it also led to securing a nice chunk of inside information over time.)So yeah, Joe‚Äôs a little nervous about hyping Coen. The thought of him leaving Tampa should make any Bucs fan nauseous or worse.
article_4.article_summary: Impressive debut as Bucs offensive coordinator amidst slight skepticism.

article_5.title: Gerald McCoy: Don‚Äôt Increase Bucky Irving Workload
article_5.post: Six-time Bucs Pro Bowl defensive tackle Gerald McCoy looks at electric rookie running back Bucky Irving and thinks of another famous fourth-round draft pick.No, it‚Äôs not Anthony Nelson. McCoy‚Äôs brain goes to Titans running back Tony Pollard, the former Cowboys standout.McCoy told KNBR radio this week that he sees Irving as a speed guy in the mold of Pollard, only smaller. And McCoy thinks if Irving gets more work than he has now, something many Bucs fans want, then a Pollard-like dropoff would be forthcoming.Dallas made Pollard its bellcow back last year after a 2022 Pro Bowl as as more of a role player. His production nosedived.McCoy doesn‚Äôt want Irving to have the same fate.‚ÄúWhen you put all of the carries on his back, then you‚Äôll get to see who he really is,‚Äù McCoy said of Irving. ‚ÄúRight now, I like him in the role he‚Äôs in. ‚Ä¶ Leave him in the role‚Äôs he‚Äôs in. Don‚Äôt put too much on him too early because what he‚Äôs doing right now is working.‚ÄùWell, Joe is glad the Bucs have a diverse corps of running backs, but Joe would still give Irving more opportunities. Some backs thrive with more touches.Irving has averaged 13 touches per game over the last five weeks. It should hurt Irving or the Bucs to have that kick up a few notches.
article_5.article_summary: McCoy cautions against increasing workload for rookie Bucky Irving.

article_7.title: The NFL In 2024: Dink-And-Dunk Works
article_7.post: It wasn‚Äôt long ago that Joe used to cringe thinking about a short-passing offense.Joe was more of a Bucco Bruce Arians, Dirk Koetter kind of a guy. Get those receivers deep and let ‚Äòer rip!No risk it; no biscuit!Liam Coen is not that kind of guy. Or, the Bucs‚Äô offensive coordinator built a short-passing offense because that style gets the most out of Baker Mayfield‚Äôs talents?Whatever the motivation, it‚Äôs working well enough that Joe is pretty convinced Coen will be working elsewhere as a head coach in 2025.Joe doesn‚Äôt want to see Coen go, but hey, if Dave Canales can get a gig after one year as Bucs offensive coordinator, so should Coen. His offense is putting up much better numbers.What surprised Joe is that the Mayfield/Coen duo is doing this with a dink-and-dunk offense. Joe has documented each week Mayfield‚Äôs passing and not very often does he throw farther than 20 yards downfield.Again, Joe cannot quibble. The offense is working.This short-passing may be a trend. Someone who goes by the handle of @Doug_Analytics put out a chart of the 36 top quarterbacks for attempting passes 20 yards downfield. Joe was a bit surprised to see Mayfield at No. 31.‚ÄúSurprised,‚Äù meaning Joe didn‚Äôt think Mayfield‚Äôs numbers would be that low.Among other quarterbacks who had similarly few long pass attempts, Pat Mahomes ranked No. 36! Jayden Daniels is No. 22 and below him are Dak Prescott (23) Matt Stafford (26) Joe Burrow (29) and Jared Goff (35).Those are are damn good quarterbacks ‚Äî with numbers throwing deep right around Mayfield‚Äôs rate.So you can win running a dink-and-dunk offense. Is this style now the new norm in the NFL?Ira Kaufman Talks Fan Disenchantment, The 2-Point Saga, Expectations, Liam Coen, And More
article_7.article_summary: Short-passing offense success in the NFL.

commenter11.post: The league has increasingly adopted a two-high safety alignment as a countermeasure to limit explosive plays. By deploying two safeties deep, defenses can neutralize vertical threats like Tyreek Hill, significantly reducing the chances of big, downfield plays. This coverage structure forces offenses to rely more on short and intermediate routes, while limiting opportunities for wide receivers to break free for long touchdowns. The focus on preventing the big play through coverage over the top creates a shift in the offensive dynamic, but it also opens the door for new strategies.

For example, Baker is not a good downfield thrower, that‚Äôs obvious to anyone that isn‚Äôt a Baker Boi. But, who cares. Tom Brady wasn‚Äôt a good runner ‚Äî well, solution, don‚Äôt ask him to run. Baker is very good at keeping plays alive and is very accurate with short passes ‚Äì and he‚Äôs being used that way. The only thing I wish they‚Äôd do different is be more creative with White, let him play that Deebo role as a RB/WR combo. article_8.title: Liam Coen: Bucs Miss Mike Evans And Chris Godwin But Offense Still Has Talent
article_8.post: Bad teams would throw in the towel after losing two great receivers, who also happen to play in the same offense, in the same game, one for weeks and the other for the season. And Bucs offensive coordinator Liam Coen understands why some would think his offense could never recover after losing Mike Evans and Chris Godwin to injuries three weeks ago.But damn it, Coen said yesterday, the Bucs offense still has talented guys that can make clutch plays. So this team isn‚Äôt dead yet.‚ÄúIt‚Äôs like, ‚ÄòHey, man, we‚Äôve got some good players, too,'‚Äù Coen said yesterday at One Buc Palace. ‚ÄúThese guys can still compete and win ‚Äì they have confidence. I need to maybe have a little bit more confidence in some ways, to be a little bit more explosive with some calls, maybe in some ways.‚ÄúBut yeah, it‚Äôs just funny when you‚Äôre on the sidelines and [Sterling Shepard] is running up to you yelling at you to throw a ball because he‚Äôs got a lot of confidence.‚ÄúAnd you know, in that two-minute drill, we hit him on the corner route on our sideline, and that was after a stoppage of clock, and he runs over and he‚Äôs like, ‚ÄòI can toast them.‚Äô And I said, ‚ÄòAlright, let‚Äôs go,‚Äô and I called the play for him in the moment to win.‚ÄùShepard is balling and his enthusiasm for the game is rubbing off on teammates, Coen noted. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs infectious, you know, in the way that he‚Äôs playing.‚ÄùEvans is expected to come back, perhaps Nov. 24 against the Giants in New Jersey, the first game after the bye week.It‚Äôs great that Bucs skill position players are so confident and eager to make plays. As down as this team was after that Baltimore beatdown, in which Evans and Godwin were lost, the Bucs needed someone like Shepard to infuse life back into the roster.Ira Kaufman Talks Fan Disenchantment, The 2-Point Saga, Expectations, Liam Coen, And More
article_8.article_summary: Bucs offense resilient despite key injuries; Shepard's infectious enthusiasm.

commenter0.post: In college Baker got to throw to guys like CeeDee Lamb, Mark Andrew‚Äôs, and Hollywood Brown. But although Shep wasn‚Äôt quite on a talent level with these guys he made up for it in gamesmanship. Glad he‚Äôs still got some left in the tank.

article_9.title: Liam Coen Says Baker Mayfield Should Play Sunday
article_9.post: Ordinarily, when a top-shelf NFL quarterback having a career year misses two straight days of practice, that sets off fire alarms, tornado warnings and emergency alert systems causing cell phones to buzz Amber Alert-like warnings across a region at 5 a.m.So far, no one is panicking at One Buc Palace.Baker Mayfield apparently has a bum toe. He didn‚Äôt practice Wednesday yesterday, though those were walk-through sessions and not real practices.On Wednesday, Mayfield said he was a little banged up but seemed confident he would play Sunday against the 49ers. Yesterday, Bucs offensive coordinator Liam Coen said he believed Mayfield would play.‚ÄúHe just took a bunch more [walk-through] reps today, actually,‚Äù Coen said.Despite the injury report Wednesday saying he didn‚Äôt practice, Coen said Mayfield got some throws in.‚ÄúHe‚Äôll be fine,‚Äù Coen said. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs moving around a lot better today than he was over the last few days. I‚Äôve been kind of [saying] quick, little [jabs], ‚ÄòHey man, you ain‚Äôt going to be able to run this week? You feeling a little slow this week? You alright?‚Äô Just to see if I can get him going.‚ÄùNot only are Mayfield‚Äôs spirits up, Coen said, he also is clapping back at Coen with his own smack.So Joe is expecting Mayfield behind center when the Bucs offense takes the field to face the 49ers.
article_9.article_summary: Mayfield expected to play despite toe injury

article_11.title: Kyle Shanahan Says Christian McCaffrey Should Play Against Bucs
article_11.post: This has been rumored for a few weeks, but 49ers coach Kyle Shanahan pretty much confirmed yesterday that star running back Christian McCaffrey should be on the field of The Licht House Sunday when the Bucs host the 49ers.McCaffrey hasn‚Äôt taken a snap yet this year because he has been dealing with Achilles/calf issues. But Shanahan told KNBR-AM 680 in San Francisco yesterday that McCaffrey has had no setbacks and he should be able to handle a full load against the Bucs.‚ÄúHe‚Äôs been awesome these last two days,‚Äù Shanahan said. ‚ÄúHopefully that continues to go well. I expect to get him out there.‚ÄùThat‚Äôs all the Bucs need is for one of the best running backs in the game to be fresh when he hits the turf Sunday.A reader of Joe‚Äôs mused on Twitter yesterday that the Bucs always seemed to do well against McCaffrey when he was with Carolina.Joe sort of agreed but also pointed out that playing running back for Riverboat Ron Rivera and Matt Rhule is a bit different than playing running back for Shanahan.Last year McCaffrey had 105 yards from scrimmage against the Bucs with a touchdown catch. In 2022, McCaffrey had 119 yards rushing and 34 yards receiving with a touchdown catch.So yeah, this isn‚Äôt great news for the Bucs.
article_11.article_summary: McCaffrey returns from injury to face Bucs.

article_12.title: ‚ÄúFive Of Their Last Eight Against 2-Win Football Teams‚Äù
article_12.post: There are soft schedules, and then there are cotton-ball, baby-bunny-soft schedules. The Bucs‚Äô have the latter to close the 2024 season. Retired Pro Bowl quarterback Alex Smith was on SiriusXM NFL Radio today talking with his co-host about how the Bucs play ‚Äúfive of their last eight [games] against 2-win football teams.‚ÄùIt‚Äôs a stunning reality.And it‚Äôs why Smith thinks the Bucs (4-5) are a likely playoff team, he said, especially if Tampa Bay can find a ‚ÄúW‚Äù at home Sunday against the 49ers before the Bucs‚Äô bye week.Like every former QB with working eyes, Smith sees Baker Mayfield playing very well and a Bucs team with enough offense to knock off the NFL‚Äôs basement clubs routinely, especially with Mike Evans slated to return.Consider that the Bucs‚Äô final three games are against the sinking Cowboys (3-5), with Dak Prescott now facing hamstring surgery, the slimy Saints (2-7) in tanking mode, and the Panthers (2-7).What a cupcake finish!Before that, it‚Äôs the two-win Giants. They rank last in the NFL in scoring at 15.4 points per game. Also on the schedule is the two-win Raiders, another game against the Panthers, and a trip to visit a tough Chargers team.To make the scene more fun, the Raiders come to Tampa in December for a 1 p.m. game following a trip to Kansas City. That‚Äôs a bad combination for a west coast team. Bucco Bruce Arians himself was on Barstool Gambling last week talking about how players on bad teams routinely check out around Thanksgiving.If the Bucs stay relatively healthy and can‚Äôt find six more wins on their schedule, then the Bucs‚Äô coaching staff will deserve the blinding spotlight that will descend upon it.Ira Kaufman Talks Fan Disenchantment, The 2-Point Saga, Expectations, Liam Coen, And More
article_12.article_summary: Favorable outlook on Bucs' easy schedule for potential playoff run.

commenter14.post:
To my fellow Bucs fans,
You dont judge a decision ONLY from the result. You judge if you made the tight or wrong decision.
By this logic the Bucs made the wrong decision cause they lost the game and the Bengals made the wrong decision cause they lost they game. So what is the right decision then ???
By that logic if the Bengals won yesterday those who defend Bowles decision would be silent today.
If you judge only by the result then the I told you so crowd is always right.
We should have gone for 2.
At this moment our Offense is better than our Defense.
Defense was a lot of time on the field and tired, you could see that in the 2nd half.
At that time we should have gone for 2. If you go to OT you may not have a chance to be at the 2yd line again. And we didnt.
Go Bucs
